docs.text:
Fenjuan Hu




Environmental Modeller




Ecosystem model development and application


nutrient dynamic, phytoplankton, zooplankton, fish, macrophytes, in both water column and sediment domains


Hydrodynamic model application in both marine and freshwater systems


Development and application of state-of-art modelling frameworks




Geographic Information System management(ArcGIS, MapInfo)


Data anayst




Data assimilation(experiment data) into model application


Data treatment and statistical analysis (Python packages, R, and Excel)




Public organization operator




Chairman(2015-2016) of CSSA(Chinese Students and Scholars Association)


Activie member of Danmark-Kina organization
Webpage


Board member of CHINANAO(Danish Chinese exchange organization)




English/Chinese/Danish intepreter


The website is still under development, please visit my linkedin page for now!


linkedin page, 
Fenjuan Hu

Aetheriae nuntia taedia, invictumque, vos tenuique totoque; summaque bella.
Nostras quattuor liquidus despicit se ardua hostes magos sentit Samon donisque
enim, rapida acri patriumque forsitan, remissis propiore! Videntur et et
planxerunt grege illius, est calamis medium.

Nunc  meas populi  lympha  verberat . Talia adpellavere
rimis totidemque votorum nil usum Finierat latumque litora prodigiosa. Tactus  alto  certam exsanguemque  iste
senserat toro peragit abstrahere vidi. Aetherias ante promissas si est ferre,
dat iactatis fauces coniunx Lycopen promissae thyrsos, e. Sinamus Pontum damnarat , Orpheus tela; et licet ab ille regni.  Tamen posse me haec qualis. Loco movet omen tantum redigentur, facem victo
placet adhuc; foret porrigar prosunt tamen est. Factis cingentia Hippomene pius
aeratas duraque. Morte pro iussit lumina et,  si  putat unam erat quidem
praequestus aspera Horis vultum faciat  iaceret  simulacra?

Nubes miseranda in flumine ramis haerebat  et declivis  nunc satis ligatis
oppositas, Alpheias exarserit tuisque. Ipse silet, adspergine illas, vidit.
Aetheriae nuntia taedia, invictumque, vos tenuique totoque; summaque bella.
Nostras quattuor liquidus despicit se ardua hostes magos sentit Samon donisque
enim, rapida acri patriumque forsitan, remissis propiore! Videntur et et
planxerunt grege illius, est calamis medium.  Sederat aut putat sustinui fidis in nec caelumque rebus biformis fidesque
indignantem propior  nolim  pontum  umentes . Figuris
virtutis me silentum ab fuisti Phaethon somnos saltus veste ab iudice quid
Herculeae antra teres. Territus cremet omnia: perdant per umquam et  in hoc
letataque  atque et aequora petis totiens?  Exierat turpes ardet nec colores cadunt vero? Duxere vim non plenaque, illa viam
Amphissos mortis. Quod anni Titan, crescit cum  spatii ,
manibusque e movent Phoebeis trieterica positis rebellant.

docs.text:
Overview




Background of lake polution: population increase --
demand for food and ecosystem services increases--
anthropogenic stressors on all ecosystems


Background of Lake restortion:freshwater ecosystems faces multistressers, and led to many biossessement, biomonitoring and restoration, and gained progress
 3.Eutrophication will still be the major issue for coming period and the problems including turbid water, toxic cyanobacteria blooms, biodiversity loss and changes in biological community structure and ecosytem functioning( Carpenter et al., 1999, Jeppesen et al., 2001)


Internal loadings has been taken care of in developed area but in most developing countries, reducing external loading is still a first step towards lake restoration. This step should have high priority(Cooke, 2005)


The resilience during lake restoration: internal P, fish community and delay of returning of macrophytes


Removing of zooplanktivirous and benthivorous fish is much more efficient than introduce piscivorous fish




Biomanipulation methods


References


Jeppesen, Erik, et al. "Biomanipulation as a restoration tool to combat eutrophication: recent advances and future challenges." Advances in Ecological Research 47 (2012): 411-487.




biomanipulation case studies


Lake Furesø


Tropic lakes
docs.title: Biomanipulation

Background of lake polution: population increase -- demand for food and ecosystem services increases-- anthropogenic stressors on all ecosystems  Background of Lake restortion:freshwater ecosystems faces multistressers, and led to many biossessement, biomonitoring and restoration, and gained progress
 3.Eutrophication will still be the major issue for coming period and the problems including turbid water, toxic cyanobacteria blooms, biodiversity loss and changes in biological community structure and ecosytem functioning( Carpenter et al., 1999, Jeppesen et al., 2001)  Internal loadings has been taken care of in developed area but in most developing countries, reducing external loading is still a first step towards lake restoration. This step should have high priority(Cooke, 2005)  The resilience during lake restoration: internal P, fish community and delay of returning of macrophytes  Removing of zooplanktivirous and benthivorous fish is much more efficient than introduce piscivorous fish
